basics.name: Daniel Plas Rivera
basics.label: Python Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: 12+ years of experience in software engineering, passionate about modern and upcoming technologies. I love enabling older applications to work with present day technologies. I enjoy working with front end and back end stacks, even the multiple layers under them.

work.summary: Working with the primary focus on data engineering initiatives at the Firm
highlights: Worked with vendor APIs team on diagnosing causes for bottlenecks
Aided Data Democracy Initiative on the Firm's unified datalake vision
Worked with various teams on preparing their data for the datalake
Taught various teams how to work with their data pipelines
Build enterprise grade pipelines that are able to perform asynchronous ETL on 100s of gigbytes of data and send data to S3
Craft intelligent systems which can alert engineer team if theres inconsistencies
Architect roadmaps, diagrams, and plans for various stages of development.
Build systems to grab Splunk logs for data analytics dashboard needs
Work with risk to ensure data meets the Firms data classification policy
Build snowpipes and snowstages for externally staged data in Azure Blob and AWS S3
Built out asynchronous python applications to take maximum advantage of REST APIs to move data faster
Built out Kafka data streams for product data
Setup AWS API Gateways and created ETL pipelines with AWS Lambda to snowflake
Stack: Python, Snaplogic, Azure SQL, Postgres, Docker, S3, Splunk, Snowflake, Snowpipe, Lambda, IAM, API Gateway

work.summary: Created PwC's Data Landscape, an analyzer to determine the risk level of data provided by a client.
highlights: Created the backend for the React SPA to consume.
Learned and implemented proprietary PwC React components
Developed stakeholder's vision to detect and assess security risks of uploaded data.
Architect roadmaps, diagrams, and plans for various stages of development.
Stack: Docker, Django3 , Python3, Graphene, Graphql, DRF, React

work.summary: Architected/rebuilt Credit Risk Rating Platform enabling internal systems to perform risk rating of customers and facilities aiding bank decision making in credit approval process, as well as ongoing portfolio management.
highlights: Create dockerized microservices with clear documentation.
Provided code reviews and broke epics into stories for the team
highly detailed documentation per micro service and python package.
Built microservice for utlizing data models for finding Probability of default of a client
Worked with team to create a new platform featuring aspects of its predecessor.
Stack: Python, flask, sqlalchemy, oracle, postgres, jenkins, docker, docker-compose, artifactory

work.position: Sr. Python Full Stack Engineer - Contractor
work.summary: Full Stack Python Engineer in Finance & Insurance, focused on Docker Container infrastructure, Pipelines in CI/CD and SOA Appliances. Analyzed and improved pre-existing architecture increasing performance of services and platform.
highlights: Made Jenkins groovy scripts to build, upload, and deployment of new docker images to Artifactory on Git PR merges.
Utilized New Relic and Splunk for identifying under performing flows, issues and bottlenecks.
Optimized code to improve performance and scalability.
Documented new and undocumented services.
Stack: Python, django, flask, celery, react, redis, oracle, postgres, mongodb, jenkins, docker, docker-compose, IBM datapower, artifactory, splunk, new relic

work.summary: Implemented VPN technologies into PwC internal tax audit platform on Azure. Used Docker/Docker-Compose to launch VPN containers when initiated by PaaS.
highlights: Debugged React and Django integrations.
Worked on VPN features for our internal tax audit platform, developed frontend, and backend solutions utilizing Django.
Refactored Python applications for SnapLogic data pipelines.
Built vSEC lab environments to mimic possible virtualized security solution configurations.
Stack: Python3, celery, celery beat, redis, sqlite, react, django, docker, docker-compose, VSTS, Azure, ip-sec, vpn, openconnect, Snaplogic, AWS, Checkpoint Vsec, pulse secure

work.summary: Collaborated cross functionally to develop target state cloud architecture and supporting organization model along with the platform roadmap required to achieve that target state.
highlights: Build REST APIs to match specs provided by other teams to deliver needed functionality.
Executes POCs and feasibility studies to validate next-gen product concepts and technologies leveraging results to guide business and technology decisions.
Enforce adherence to architectural standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines, usability design standards
Stack: Python3, Microsoft Azure, Terraform, Packer, Git, Flask, Flask-RestPlus, MongoDB, TDD, Agile, Kanban, Jenkins

work.summary: Transitioned university to a Python stack while maintaining compatibility with legacy technologies.
highlights: Built Full Stack Python Applications for the University.
Wrote Python scripts to parse JSON documents and load the data in database.
Development locally with Vagrant and Docker for virtualized instances of servers and databases on the fly.
Built REST APIs to serve out data from databases to legacy systems.
Programmatically established levels of authorized access to restrict-allow systems REST API access.
Created and planned out the server flow infrastructure for python web app stack for Columbia University.
Followed Agile SDLC, made sure code was always up to PEP8 standards, and servers (with code) passed unit & load tests.

Stack: Python3, python2, GIT, Flask/Blueprint, JIRA, Apache 2.2, Mod_WSGI, Oracle(11g,12c), Axure RP, Vagrant, Docker, Jenkins, Virtualbox, Postman, LTI, Oauth1, Oauth2, REST, Sakai, Canvas, Unix Bash/Shell Script, CRON, JavaScript, Nodejs, JSON

work.summary: Based on your location you will be exposed real time to information in real time, based on their location!

Created and managed, and implemented new features for subsidiaries’ e-commerce companies JuicifyMe, LibrettoEspresso, MyEspressoStore.

awards.title: Hack NYU Hackathon
awards.summary: MVP Winner. SudoLove connects participants, sponsors and mentors for global hackathons via an app.

awards.title: AngelHack 2016 Manhattan
awards.summary: Winning Grand Prize(Hackcelerator) and Best Use Of Amazon Web Services. New York Minute is your pocket companion app to eliminate the frustration of getting around in New York City. It calculates the fastest, cheapest way to get to the desired destination by comparing the Uber car service and public transportation. Target users are New Yorkers who understand the fast pace of New York City life. Sponsors Technologies used Amazon AWS: Elastic Beanstalk, EBS, EC2, Route 53, S3 Amazon Alexa Esri ArcGIS.

references.name: Latonia Robinson, Dir. of Operations, The K.I.S. Foundation
references.reference: Daniel is an absolute joy to work with and continues to impress us with his technical skill sets. Whenever we have a problem with our website, he always has the answer or recommendations for improvement. Daniel follows direction well, he's always aware of the latest programs or trends, he works well with deadlines, he's able to communicate effectively, he's super reliable, and his experience is absolutely priceless. We're so thankful to have him working with us as part of our team!

references.name: Antonio Riccardi, Web Engineer at Basics Plus
references.reference: Daniel is one of the best developers we know. His speed and ability to conquer any challenge thrown at him helped us recover our online presence. He led our team here through rigorous challenges with unique solutions each time always getting the job done before the deadlines. Working with him was a blast and we would recommend him when it comes to handling tough projects!
